text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Teachers in tertiary education dismiss offered pay increase as "humiliating". Staff stick to claims and to planned three-day strike due to start on Saturday.
- Troops kill about 100 rebels, destroy main rear base in Tizi-Ouzou region, in major operation lasting five days.

- Scarcely 40 days after being formed, National Democratic Rally is holding congress -- a remarkable performance when other political grouping have so far failed to do so, including those in existence several years.
- Several political leaders appear to fear battle for June 5 parliamentary elections, failing so far to announce officially whether they will stand.
